articles.title: Mandatory measles immunity for maids working in households with young children who are not fully vaccinated
articles.description: The measure will come into effect from Sep 1.
articles.content:
SINGAPORE: From Sep 1, maids working in households with young children who are not fully vaccinated against measles must be immunised against the disease.
This mandatory immunisation is aimed at protecting "unvaccinated young childen who are at highe... [2419 chars]

articles.title: What researchers found when they compared food labels in 17 countries
articles.description: New research uncovers how hyper-palatable foods saturate the US food supply and highlights urgent public health challenges posed by engineered foods worldwide.
articles.content: A global analysis of over 314,000 food items found that hyper-palatable foods, engineered to drive overeating, are widespread in the US and Europe, but especially prevalent in the US and Bulgaria. Countries like Italy and Germany offer healthier food... [7652 chars]

articles.title: Manalo, Rubio meet in Washington to strengthen PH-US alliance amid WPS tensions
articles.description: The Philippines and the United States once again reaffirmed their strong alliance as the foundation of peace and stability in the Indo-Pacific, along with a commitment to further expand security and economic cooperation amid China’s increasing assertiveness in the South China Sea.
articles.content:
Foreign Affairs Secretary Enrique Manalo and US Secretary of State Marco Rubio exchange pleasantries during their meeting in Washington, DC on June 9, 2025. US State Department

articles.title: Explained: Why scientists study tardigrades, tiny eight-legged ‘water bears’, in space
articles.description: Tardigrades have been a part of space missions since 2007, when some 3,000 moss piglets hitched a ride to space aboard the European Space Agency’s Foton-M3 mission
articles.content:
Among the scientific experiments astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla will undertake during his two week stay at the International Space Station (ISS) is one that will examine the revival, survival, and reproduction of tardigrades in space.
What is the Voyage... [5021 chars]

articles.title: Would you trust a life form engineered in a lab? Here’s why it matters
articles.description: A new report from Rice University’s Baker Institute outlines six core ethical challenges in synthetic biology, including risks, equity, and environmental impacts.
articles.content:
Can synthetic biology deliver on its promise without repeating the ethical failures of past technologies? This new report maps the crossroads of innovation, risk, and responsibility, revealing what’s at stake for our future.

articles.title: Stanley Cup Final 2025: Panthers maul Oilers in Game 3 to take 2-1 edge in series
articles.description: The Panthers pounced on the Oilers in 6-1 victory
articles.content:
After a pair of incredibly close games to start the Stanley Cup Final, Game 3 was anything but that. The Panthers hammered the Oilers from start to finish in a 6-1 win, and they now have a 2-1 lead in the series.
It took Florida all of 56 seconds to ... [1782 chars]

articles.title: Mandatory measles immunity requirement MDWs
articles.description: From 1 September 2025, employers of migrant domestic workers (MDWs) must ensure that their MDW has immunity against measles if their households have a child below seven years old who is not fully vaccinated against measles. This measure will enhance...
